title: Why Marvin Harrison Jr.'s HOF dad struggles watching him play for the Cardinals
content: Marvin Harrison Sr. is trying to find the balance of being the father of a current player on a struggling team.

title: Braves hire Weiss as manager to replace Snitker
content: The Braves on Monday named Walt Weiss, who has been Atlanta's bench coach since 2018, their new manager.

title: Quinn: Left Daniels in too long, '100% on me'
content: Commanders coach Dan Quinn on Monday said the decision to have QB Jayden Daniels on the field with the game out of reach was "100 percent on me."

title: Taylor: Brown's shot at Bengals' D uncalled for
content: Bengals coach Zac Taylor took exception to comments made by Chase Brown following Sunday's loss to the Bears, saying Monday that they were better left unsaid.

title: Chargers' Alt to get season-ending ankle surgery
content: Chargers left tackle Joe Alt will miss the rest of the season as he prepares to undergo season-ending ankle surgery following a second high right ankle sprain.

title: Sources: Spurs rookie Harper (calf) to miss weeks
content: Spurs rookie guard Dylan Harper suffered a left calf strain Sunday and is expected to miss multiple weeks, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Alabama suspends DB Kirkpatrick after arrest
content: Alabama defensive back Dre Kirkpatrick Jr. has been suspended indefinitely following his arrest over the weekend, coach Kalen DeBoer said Monday.

title: Source: UFC releases fighter amid betting probe
content: UFC fighter Isaac Dulgarian has been released from the roster two days after sportsbooks flagged unusual betting interest against him ahead of his first-round loss to Yadier del Valle, a source told ESPN.

title: Bregman, Bellinger, Diaz opt for MLB free agency
content: Alex Bregman, Cody Bellinger and Edwin Diaz are among the more than 140 players so far to have opted out of their contracts and will become free agents.

title: From Kyle Schwarber to Alex Bregman: Best fits for top free agents
content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: Barnwell: Two days after Halloween, four Super Bowl contenders proved to be not-so-scary
content: Have the Bills solved the Chiefs? Did Colts QB Daniel Jones regress? Do the Packers and Lions have underlying concerns, and could either make a trade?

title: Takeaways: Darnold dazzles, wild upsets and Daniels' injury
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions from each game. Here's what we learned from Week 9.

title: A top-10 upset, 27 points from Blakes and UConn on tap: Women's college hoops is back!
content: Baylor's top-10 upset of Duke and Mikayla Blakes' 27 points helped open the women's 2025-26 season Monday.

title: Everything that had to go right for Florida to prepare for a title defense
content: The Gators needed the right dominoes to fall before they could set their sights on back-to-back championships.

title: 'It feels like they gave up': Inside Myles Turner's painful exit from the Pacers -- to their fiercest rival
content: As he's tried to balance the memories of a decade in Indiana, Turner is embracing the other side of this heated rivalry. "[Indiana] made it very clear how they valued me," he said. "And so did the Milwaukee Bucks."

title: The NHL's best this week: Caufield, Canadiens now a must-watch
content: The 24-year-old is setting franchise records for the Habs. Plus, a look at key games coming up around the NHL.

title: Buzz: What is Jayden Daniels' injury outlook going forward?
content: Look beyond the fantasy points leaderboard to see who got the carries, the targets and the opportunities.

title: Larson's NASCAR Cup crown comes at Hamlin's heartbreaking expense
content: Kyle Larson won his second NASCAR title on Sunday, but even he didn't feel right seeing another championship slip through Denny Hamlin's fingers.

title: Tottenham have big problems; Haaland lifts Man City again; Griezmann scores 200; more
content: All is clearly not well with Tottenham after this weekend's lopsided 1-0 defeat to Chelsea. Plus: Spalletti's Juve debut ends in a win, Erling Haaland keeps scoring for Man City and Antoine Griezmann hits 200.

title: Power Rankings: Does anyone stand a chance against KC?
content: The 2025 NWSL regular season is in the rearview mirror, so ESPN takes a look at the eight playoff teams and ranks them from first to worst.

title: AP Week 10 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: There wasn't much drama in the top 5, with Alabama and Texas A&M idle, but Georgia did squeak out a win.

title: 17 men's college basketball teams that could win 30 games in 2025-26
content: History says a 30-win season could lead to a national title (see: Florida). Which teams could achieve the feat this season?

title: Two pumps, one flag: Rico Dowdle's celebration reaches Keegan-Michael Key
content: Six teammates joined the celebration, a 15-yard flag followed and now the Panthers RB -- and Keegan-Michael Key -- are questioning where the league draws the line.

title: First bets for Week 10: Browns and Eagles to cover in Week 10, plus an MVP pick
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are four early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: Ryan Rollins, Quentin Grimes add instant offense
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool to sign Fulham's Kevin?
content: After a fine start to Fulham this season, Liverpool are keeping tabs on their forward Kevin. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Restructuring of Panjab University’s senate-syndicate has exposed ‘BJP’s anti-Punjab face’, says ex-Cong min
content: Mr. Sidhu stated that under the pretext of improving the functioning of Panjab University, the Central government has almost eliminated the representation of teachers, principals, and alumni in its syndicate

title: Dynastic politics 'grave threat' to Indian democracy: Shashi Tharoor
content: Mr. Tharoor said that when political power is determined by lineage rather than ability, commitment, or grassroots engagement, the quality of governance suffers

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Modi invokes katta jibe again, Priyanka slams PM, Kharge says Nitish ‘in BJP’s lap’
content: All top leaders of the NDA and Mahagathbandhan were busy touring Bihar and trading barbs as the campaign for the polls intensified

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta heads to Bihar for three-day campaigning in Assembly polls
content: Ms. Gupta will address a public meeting in Bankipur Assembly constituency, after reaching the State capital Patna. She will also campaign in Siwan, Barharia, Baikunthpur and nearby areas on 4 November

title: BJP delegation meets ECI officials, demands vetting of Bengal government’s citizenship documents for SIR
content: The memorandum submitted by the BJP leadership to the ECI stated that ground realities in West Bengal are different from Bihar and alleged that the State has witnessed large-scale issuance of backdated and forged documents which should be vetted during SIR

title: Take proactive steps to reduce pollution, SC tells authorities
content: Amicus curiae and senior advocate Aparajita Singh highlighted media reports indicating that several air quality monitoring stations in Delhi had not functioned during the Deepavali festival days.

title: Former BJD Rajya Sabha MP Amar Patnaik joins BJP
content: Months ago, Patnaik, a former accountant general, played key role in leading BJD’s charge on alleged discrepancy and irregularities in 2024 elections and how it benefited BJP

title: Mushrooms key to achieving nutritional security, says UAS-B VC
content: ‘Even though mushroom cultivation is a promising venture, the existing market in India was very limited compared to China and other countries’

title: M.P. govt. wants to opt out of decentralised procurement system
content: Congress slams Bharatiya Janata Party government, accuses it of betraying farmers and pushing them “into a serious crisis”; State says “government is committed to purchasing every grain“

title: Bombay HC clears way for 26/11 mastermind Abu Jundal’s trial
content: Judge quashes order passed by trial court asking the authorities to produce documents related to the arrest of the accused

title: Karnataka announces ₹600 crore fund to push ‘Deep Tech Decade’
content: This initiative reflects our vision to create a robust DeepTech pipeline supporting entrepreneurs working on technologies such as AI, ML, quantum computing, advanced manufacturing, robotics, and sustainability-driven innovation, says Priyank Kharge

title: BJP formed govt. with stolen votes, alleges former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik
content: BJP government is not a game-changer but a name-changer — a government busy only in rebranding welfare schemes started during BJD government, claims Patnaik

title: Researchers at IIT-M and Ohio State varsity develop AI framework that mimics real-time chemical synthesis
content: They say the framework, named PURE, promises to cut down early stage timelines of drug development, which is sometimes a decades-long process that costs millions of dollars

title: Set up SIT to probe doctor’s death, Supriya Sule urges Fadnavis
content: Doctors’ association calls for systemic reforms to ensure the mental well-being of medical professionals serving in government healthcare institutions

title: Cong government spared no one in its cheating: KTR
content: He said the the government was targeting the poor through the HYDRAA drive, which would raze houses in Borabanda as well if the ruling party secures the seat

title: Allahabad High Court orders ₹50,000 compensation for man jailed in false anti-conversion case
content: The Bench said the case was an example of the “State authorities falling and scrambling over each other in order to score brownie points” on the basis of an FIR

title: SIR is a hurried exercise that aims to terrorise people of West Bengal, says TMC
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will lead a rally in protest against SIR in Kolkata on Tuesday, while the LoP Suvendu Adhikari will be lead a rally in Panihati supporting the SIR

title: Delhi High Court upholds FSSAI ban on sale of beverages with ‘ORS’ branding
content: The Delhi High Court upholds the FSSAI’s order barring companies from using the label ‘ORS’, citing serious health risks for consumers

title: Families of Indians fighting Russia’s war with Ukraine protest, demand safe return of kin
content: The protesting family members said that agents ‘lured’ young men with lucrative job offers and promise of citizenship, and they were sent to the war zone

title: Air India flight diverted to Mongolia due to a technical glitch
content: The airline said that the Boeing 777-300 aircraft was undergoing checks, and it was making efforts to take passengers to their destination

title: Need for shift in focus from food security to nutrition security: PM
content: Modi addresses experts at first Emerging Science Technology and Innovation Conclave, which replaces the Indian Science Congress

title: Farmers’ groups question new tractor emission norms
content: They opposed TREM-IV and TREM-V emission norms for tractors as they could severely increase economic burdens and hardships for farmers

title: Transwomen face closure of shelter as govt. allegedly delays payment of funds
content: The residents, eight transwomen including college students, say they are facing uncertainty over food and shelter as the trust wants them to move out, unwilling to run the shelter home without adequate funds

title: We are one step away from solving climate change: Chemistry Laureate
content: The country is extremely well positioned to build on an innovative sense, said the Scottish chemist, David MacMillan

title: Lakshadweep woman out of danger after treatment for new amoebic brain infection variant, says hospital
content: The patient, who works in Edappally, had been admitted three weeks ago with a severe headache, vomiting, and an eye movement disorder

title: GBA Chief orders urgent action as city misses CM’s pothole deadline
content: He has directed senior officials of all city corporations to personally inspect the roads, identify damaged stretches, and take swift action to fill potholes

title: Kerala Chief Minister to inaugurate KIIFB silver jubilee celebrations on Tuesday
content: According to the Kerala government, KIIFB has to date approved 1,190 projects worth ₹90,562 crore across various sectors

title: ‘Supposed’ trade deal with U.S. seems to have become an ordeal for India, says Congress
content: Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh says there was a time when it looked like India would host the Quad Summit but that was unlikely now

title: Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls begins in 12 States, Union Territories on November 4
content: This major exercise will cover close to 51 crore voters. The first round of the clean-up exercise was carried out in Bihar earlier this year, during which more than 68 lakh names were deleted from the electoral rolls.

title: Hibi to send letter to Health Minister demanding handover of Corporation building to Ernakulam GH
content: A few members of the Hospital Development Committee (HDC) have also expressed interest in acquiring the premises, citing its potential to ease space constraints and improve healthcare services

title: Unity remains key challenge for UDF in Malappuram
content: In the 2020 elections, the UDF maintained its unity in most local bodies in Malappuram. However, it faced internal conflicts in panchayats such as Ponmundam, Karuvarakundu and Makkaraparamba, where the Congress and Indian Union Muslim League had disagreements despite reconciliation efforts by the UDF leadership

title: Andhra Pradesh targets ₹9.8 lakh cr MoUs, 7.5 lakh jobs at CII Partnership Summit 2025
content: Minister Nara Lokesh says focus on Speed of Doing Business and industry-friendly policies has positioned Andhra Pradesh as a top investment destination; major projects by Google and ArcelorMittal to boost investor confidence

title: Adilabad Collector asked to acquire 700 acres of land for development of joint user Airport in Adilabad
content: The initiative would fulfill the long-cherished dream of denizens of Adilabad district and its surrounding areas for air passenger connectivity

title: 14 dead as dumper truck ploughs into multiple vehicles in Rajasthan
content: The police said the driver hit a car, prompting locals to chase him. He accelerated further, hitting pedestrians and bikers along the road. He then stopped after colliding with a trailer truck and a car on the Delhi-Ajmer Highway. It is suspected he was under the influence of alcohol.

title: Alcobev firms want Telangana govt. to clear dues by Nov. 10 to avoid shortfall in supplies
content: Three bodies representing the alcoholic beverage companies urge govt. to pay outstanding using new retail licence application fee; the firms otherwise will not be able to meet December demand

title: ‘Govt. working on making mental health part of school education system’
content: Samagra Shiksha Assistant State Project Director highlighted the State government’s commitment to nurturing the emotional and career growth of students

title: Steep reduction in employment through MGNREG scheme in Telangana
content: Report by LibTech India finds sharp decline of 47.6% in the number of person days generated when compared to the same period last year; resultant wage loss at State level amounts to ₹802.57 crore

title: Kerala State Film Awards: words paved the way for Shamla Hamza to cinema
content: Shamla Hamza initially pursued a career as a lyricist, but unexpectedly transitioned to acting at an audition for the film 1001 Nunakal. Her performance led her to be cast in Feminichi Fathima, in which she portrays a woman who perseveres in a quiet way against patriarchal and religious oppression to make true a simple wish.

title: Delhi High Court urges Centre to act swiftly for return of Indian student detained in Ukraine
content: The 22-year-old youth’s mother apprehends that he has been duped into fighting for the Russian forces in the country’s war with Ukraine. The court granted four weeks to the Centre to submit a status report that specifies the steps taken on the plea made by the mother.

title: With an eye on future, Osama has a past to contend with
content: Osama Shahab, the son of the late gangster-turned-MP Mohammad Shahabuddin, is a reticent politician who is trying his best to connect with the local people despite his father’s dreaded past

title: Cash, liquor, drugs worth over ₹100 crore seized: Election Commission
content: A total of 824 flying squads have been deployed across Bihar to ensure that complaints reported on C-VIGIL app are attended to within 100 minutes, says ECI

title: No chargesheets yet in CSR funds scam cases
content: In September, police had said chargesheets were being prepared on the ADGP’s instructions to file them without delay

title: President Droupadi Murmu hails Uniform Civil Code of Uttarakhand
content: The President addresses special session of Uttarakhand Assembly marking silver jubilee celebrations of the formation of the State

title: Project to promote Kuttiady coconut gets a shot in the arm
content: The involvement of the Responsible Tourism Mission Society is expected to replicate the ‘Kumarakom model’ in Kuttiady, wherein everything associated with this elite variety of coconut palms and the orchards will unfold a bundle of tourism opportunities

title: SCR nears completion of key third-line projects to boost rail capacity
content: The most important among them is the 219-km Vijayawada-Kazipet third-line project, spanning both Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, at a cost of ₹1,952 crore

title: Private bank employees stage dharna raising demands
content: Major demands include nationalising private banks and appointment of permanent clerical staff in such banks

title: DMK moves Supreme Court against SIR, says it is de facto NRC
content: The unilateral imposition of such an unprecedented, resource‑intensive and socially disruptive process on a State, without consultation or demonstrable administrative exigency, transgresses the federal structure of the Constitution, recognised as part of its basic structure, says the petition submitted in the maiden challenge to the second phase of the SIR

title: Scientific precision will guide SLBC completion, says Uttam
content: The heli-borne magnetic survey, conducted using a special transmitter fitted to the helicopter, will collect geological data up to a depth of 1,000 metres, to help identify underground shear zones and water flow patterns, which are critical for planning and executing the SLBC tunnel works

title: Amid promises of jobs, youth in Bihar desperate to get public employment
content: Thousands of young aspirants crowd small libraries, clinging to the dream of a government job; many say corruption, paper leaks, irregular exams and delayed notifications have crushed their morale; with recruitment halted in key departments, frustration is growing across towns and villages

title: Andhra Pradesh to launch CMEGP to boost entrepreneurship in MSME sector
content: New programme, modelled on PMEGP, to raise investment limits and support creation of 5,000–6,000 new units across the State

title: Great Nicobar Island project: map ready for denotification of tribal reserve
content: Comprehensive Tribal Welfare Plan to be finalised next month, to include ‘consideration’ of Nicobarese’s demand to return to ancestral villages

title: Fearing fraud: Canada study permit refusal rate to Indians hit 74% in Aug
content: Canada's study permit crackdown disproportionately impacts Indian applicants, with refusal rates soaring to 74% in August 2025. This surge, driven by fraud concerns and stricter verification, has halved Indian applications. Universities report significant enrolment drops, while students now question Canada's long-term settlement prospects, a stark contrast to past 'study, work, stay' assurances.

title: India's World Cup win: Twitter 'explodes' 456%; shares Virat Kohli tweet
content: India's women's cricket team has achieved a historic maiden World Cup victory, sparking a massive 456.5% surge in conversations on X (formerly Twitter) within 24 hours. The nation erupted in celebration after the team's dominant performance against South Africa. This monumental win, lauded by figures like Virat Kohli, Sundar Pichai, and Satya Nadella, marks a new era for women's cricket in India and inspires future generations.

title: Bihar polls: The ‘ruins of Marhowra’ make jobs a touchy topic
content: Marhowra, once a symbol of Bihar's industrial might with its sugar mill and engineering company, now grapples with defunct factories and job scarcity. Despite new ventures like a diesel locomotive plant, locals seek substantial employment. The revival of old industries remains a distant hope amidst electoral promises and economic challenges.

title: Comet 3I/ATLAS: Musk, Rogan talk about alien object; link it to The Tunguska Event
content: Unauthorized SpaceX Starshield transmissions coincide with intense scrutiny of Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar object exhibiting anomalous characteristics. Discussions on The Joe Rogan Experience podcast, featuring Elon Musk, explored potential alien probes and the Tunguska Event, fueled by astrophysicist Avi Loeb's claims of extraterrestrial origins for the comet.

title: Who is Neal Katyal? Indian-American lawyer who could upend Trump's tariff war
content: Neal Katyal, an Indian-American attorney, will argue before the Supreme Court whether President Trump has the authority to impose sweeping tariffs under IEEPA. The landmark case, deemed critically important by Trump himself, centers on whether taxing power rests with Congress or the President. Katyal previously secured a win for plaintiffs in a lower court, asserting the President lacks such authority.

title: One question that made OpenAI CEO Sam Altman 'uneasy'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman defended massive spending plans, dismissing concerns about the company's financial projections. He asserted OpenAI's revenue is higher than reported and offered to find buyers for shares from critics. Altman emphasized a strategy of steep revenue growth across multiple ventures, confident in future expansion and technological advancements.

title: NTA clarifies: No calculators allowed in JEE (Main); 'typo' sparks confusion
content: Confusion erupted over calculator use in JEE (Main) 2026 after the NTA's initial bulletin mentioned an on-screen calculator. The agency swiftly clarified this was a typographical error, stating calculators are strictly prohibited. Officials explained the mistake stemmed from adapting general instructions from other exams. A revised bulletin now confirms the ban, following intervention from the Ministry of Education.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobe’s heartbreaking moment focused on Gianna
content: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.

title: Taylor Swift worried about security as Travis Kelce focuses on new season
content: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about her security and privacy, wanting to avoid excessive media attention during Kansas City Chiefs games. While not asking for broadcasts to stop, she desires to maintain a lower profile. Meanwhile, Travis Kelce praised Swift's latest album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on his podcast, highlighting its success.

title: Mets tipped to sign $16M Braves star as Pete Alonso replacement before deadline
content: The New York Mets are eyeing Atlanta Braves slugger Marcell Ozuna as a potential replacement for Pete Alonso, whose future with the team is uncertain. Ozuna, a veteran power hitter, could fill a crucial gap in the Mets' lineup. The Braves' shift in DH strategy might make the three-time All-Star available, offering New York a surprising, yet impactful, solution.

title: Critical lifeline: Indian docs, nurses backbone of US, EU healthcare - OECD report
content: Indian doctors and nurses are now crucial to advanced economies, with the OECD reporting a significant surge in their numbers. India is the top source of migrant doctors and second for nurses in member countries. This reliance highlights both a vital support and a potential vulnerability for global healthcare systems.

title: Gabrielle Union recalls Hollywood racism in candid throwback confession
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of NBA star Dwyane Wade, bravely shares her experiences with racism in Hollywood, detailing career setbacks despite her talent.  She also stood by Wade during his cancer battle, showcasing their strong bond.  Despite challenges, Union remains a celebrated actress, proving her resilience and worth in the industry.

title: India women's cricket team becomes crorepati: Who gave what to World Cup winners
content: India clinched their maiden Women's World Cup title, defeating South Africa by 52 runs in a thrilling final. Deepti Sharma's exceptional bowling performance was key to the victory. The triumph was met with significant cash rewards from the BCCI, ICC, and state governments for the victorious team.

title: From duty to glory! UP Police hail DSP Deepti Sharma; salute World Cup hero
content: Uttar Pradesh DGP Rajeev Krishna lauded DSP Deepti Sharma for her stellar performance in India's ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 victory. Her exceptional all-round display, including a record-breaking fifty and five-wicket haul in the final, earned her Player of the Tournament. Her achievement brings immense pride to the nation and Uttar Pradesh Police.

title: LeBron James ruled out vs Blazers tonight due to sciatica injury
content: LeBron James remains sidelined for the Lakers' November 4th clash against the Trail Blazers due to a persistent sciatica injury. While the team navigates his absence, Austin Reaves has stepped up significantly, showcasing impressive scoring and playmaking.  The Lakers are prioritizing James' long-term health, with hopes for his return later this month.

title: 'Ashamed?' PM asks why Lalu missing from RJD posters; Tejashwi hits back
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi attacked the RJD in poll-bound Bihar, questioning the absence of Lalu Prasad Yadav from party posters and his son Tejashwi's reluctance to mention his father's name. Modi alleged this indicates the RJD is trying to hide its "jungle raj" legacy from the youth.

title: When the body attacks its joints: Expert explains inflammatory arthritis
content: Inflammatory arthritis, where the immune system attacks healthy joints, demands early attention. Watch for persistent joint pain, swelling, morning stiffness exceeding 30 minutes, fatigue, fever, symmetrical pain, and unexplained weight loss. Timely diagnosis and management through medication, gentle exercise, a balanced diet, stress control, and regular check-ups can prevent dependency and ensure active lives.

title: Ja Morant set to play vs Pistons after serving one-game
content: Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant returns tonight against the Detroit Pistons. He missed one game following a team dispute. His absence was felt in their recent loss. Morant's return is crucial for the Grizzlies' offensive rhythm and to stabilize their season. He is cleared to play with no injury concerns.

title: Bucks vs Pacers: Full injury report, expected lineups and key matchup notes
content: The Milwaukee Bucks, with Giannis Antetokounmpo probable despite knee tendinopathy, face the injury-plagued Indiana Pacers on November 3, 2025.  The Pacers are without Tyrese Haliburton for the season and several other key players, forcing them to rely on their supporting cast. Milwaukee enters as 6.5-point favorites, aiming to maintain their winning streak against a depleted Indiana squad.

title: India’s hiring shift: Experience matters; degrees alone no longer guarantee jobs
content: Indian students are shifting focus from mere degrees to demonstrable skills as employers prioritize practical experience.  Companies are actively collaborating with universities to co-design curricula and build talent pipelines.  Apprenticeship programs are experiencing a significant resurgence, offering students hands-on learning and a faster entry into the workforce.  This marks a crucial mindset reset for the nation's talent ecosystem.

title: Marathi actress Daya Dongre passes away; Maharashtra deputy CM mourns her demise
content: Veteran Marathi actress Daya Dongre, celebrated for her impactful roles in films, television, and theatre, has passed away at 85 due to age-related ailments. Dongre, who began her acting journey in her teens and studied at the National School of Drama, left an indelible mark on Maharashtra's art world. Her contributions were recognized by the Government of Maharashtra.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo listed probable vs Pacers in latest Bucks injury update
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable to play for the Milwaukee Bucks against the Indiana Pacers tonight, despite dealing with left knee patellar tendinopathy. His expected return is crucial for the Bucks, who aim to build momentum, while the injury-plagued Pacers face an uphill battle. Antetokounmpo's dominant presence is key to Milwaukee's success.

title: Viral! Rohit Sharma's doppelganger trains Harmanpreet Kaur for trophy walk - WATCH
content: India's women's cricket team achieved a historic victory, winning their first ICC ODI World Cup. Skipper Harmanpreet Kaur led the team to a 52-run win against South Africa. The triumph marks a significant moment for Indian women's sports. The team's performance and captain's leadership are highlighted. This win signifies the start of a new era for women's cricket in India.

title: Why Zohran Mamdani cannot be the new Barack Obama
content: The Obama analogy flatters everyone — liberals nostalgic for 2008, Mamdani himself, and commentators desperate for a “narrative.” But it is also wrong, for reasons that have less to do with Mamdani’s talent and more to do with where he is, who he is, and the country he is trying to win.

title: 'Khatron Ke Khiladi': BJP hails Tharoor's article on dynastic politics; Cong hits back
content: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor's article criticizing dynastic politics has been seized upon by the BJP. Tharoor's essay, calling it a "grave threat to Indian democracy," highlighted the Nehru-Gandhi family's influence and extended the critique to other INDIA bloc parties. BJP leaders lauded Tharoor's "insightful" piece, using it to target the Congress leadership.

title: 'I'm broken': Lone AI-171 crash survivor speaks out; now stranded in UK
content: Four-and-a-half months after a devastating Air India crash, sole survivor Viswashkumar Ramesh faces ongoing physical injuries, financial hardship, and deep trauma. He has not yet received NHS psychiatric care and his family's business has collapsed. Ramesh finds Air India's interim compensation inadequate for his needs.

title: 'Chana kha rahe the?': Jemimah reacts to Mandhana's 'win' - watch
content: Amanjot Kaur's spectacular catch to dismiss South Africa's captain Laura Wolvaardt proved a turning point in the Women's World Cup final, securing India's maiden title.  Her crucial fielding, alongside Deepti Sharma's all-round performance and Shafali Verma's batting, led India to a historic 52-run victory. Jemimah Rodrigues playfully protested Smriti Mandhana topping the leaderboard set by fielding coach Munish Bali.

title: Woman Arrested For Killing 4-Year-Old Stepson In Uttarakhand: Cops
content: A woman allegedly pushed her four-year-old stepson in a fit of rage who died from the injuries sustained here in Dehradun, police said on Monday.

title: 6 Killed, 2 Injured In Car-Truck Crash In UP: Cops
content: Six people were killed and two others seriously injured when a car and a truck collided head-on in Barabanki district of Uttar Pradesh on Monday evening, officials said.

title: After Months Of Killings, 2 Sudan Cities Now Facing Acute Famine
content: A global hunger monitor on Monday confirmed famine conditions in al-Fashir, the Sudanese city taken by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) after a lengthy siege, as well as Kadugli, another besieged city in Sudan's south.

title: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav On Brazil's New Proposal To Protect Trees
content: Brazil has tabled a proposal for the Tropical Forests Forever Facility, a "pay-for-performance" fund that could become the planet's largest multilateral mechanism for tropical forest conservation, said Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav.

title: Municipal Vehicle Falls Into River Moments After Inauguration In Kerala
content: A municipal vehicle fell into a river moments after it was inaugurated during a flag-off ceremony in Kerala's Palakkad district on Monday. Both passengers in the vehicle escaped unharmed.

title: Girl Raped By Teen; A Hospital Visit Revealed Pregnancy, Months Of Abuse
content: Police here have apprehended a juvenile for allegedly repeatedly raping a minor and impregnating her, an officer said on Monday.

title: US Government Shutdown Forces Cuts To Food Aid For 42 Million Americans
content: The White House will send only partial food aid payments to 42 million low-income Americans, as the government shutdown crippling public services nears record length, officials told a judge Monday.

title: Trial To Resume For Man Who Taught Hindi To 26/11 Terrorists
content: The long-stalled trial of Zabiuddin Ansari alias Abu Jundal, who taught Hindi and local mannerisms to the 10 terrorists involved in the horrific 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, is set to finally resume.

title: Businessman Was On Way Home, Stopped On Bridge, Robbed Off Rs 10 Lakh
content: A group of unidentified criminals allegedly looted Rs 10 lakh from a businessman on a bridge in Odisha's Koraput district. The incident took place on the Kotpad-Kundura road, police said.

title: Mehul Choksi Appeals Against Extradition To India In Belgium Supreme Court
content: Fugitive diamond trader Mehul Choksi has challenged before Belgium's Supreme Court an October 17 ruling by the Antwerp Court of Appeal that had upheld India's request for his extradition, calling it "enforceable", officials said on Monday.

title: Why Bhumihars Are The Pivot Of 2025 Bihar Assembly Elections
content: In the heart of Bihar, along the bank of the Ganga river, the town of Mokama (in the district of Patna) is an important and historically significant town known for being an industrial area in the past, a major lentil production centre.

title: In A First, Maldives Bans Smoking For Those Born After 2007
content: The Maldives began implementing a smoking ban Saturday on anyone born after January 2007, becoming the only nation with a generational prohibition on tobacco, the Health Ministry said.

title: Haze Blankets Delhi As Air Quality Remains 'Very Poor'
content: A thick layer of haze enveloped the national capital on Monday, with the air quality remaining in the "very poor" category and very likely to deteriorate to "severe" on Tuesday.

title: Tiruchi Hospital Licence Cancelled Over Organ Transplant Racket Claim, Court Objects
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court has set aside the Tamil Nadu government's order cancelling the organ transplant licence of Tiruchi's Cethar Hospital.

title: Air Passengers May Soon Be Allowed To Cancel, Amend Tickets Without Paying More
content: Air passengers may soon be allowed to cancel or amend their tickets without additional charges within 48 hours of booking, with aviation watchdog DGCA proposing significant changes in the ticket refund norms.

title: Delhi-Bengaluru Air India Flight Diverted To Bhopal Due To Technical Snag
content: An Air India flight from Delhi to Bengaluru with 172 persons on board was diverted to Bhopal due to a technical snag and made a safe landing under emergency conditions at the Raja Bhoj Airport here on Monday night, an official said.

title: 5 Million Holocaust Victims Identified. AI Will Help Identify 2,50,000 More
content: Five million of the more than six million Jews killed in the Holocaust have now been identified, and with the further help of artificial intelligence (AI), even more names could be recovered, Israeli researchers said on Monday.

title: OpenAI To Meta: How Tech Giants Are Pouring Billions Into AI Infrastructure
content: OpenAI and Amazon have signed a multi-year agreement worth $38 billion under which the e-commerce giant will provide the ChatGPT maker access to hundreds of thousands of Nvidia processors to train and run its artificial intelligence models.

title: Flight Ops At Mumbai Airport To Be Closed For 6 Hours On Nov 20
content: Adani Group-AAI-owned Mumbai International Airport will remain shut for flight operations for six hours on November 20 as the facility operator plans to carry out a comprehensive annual post-monsoon runway maintenance work

title: Cash, Drugs, Liquor Worth Over Rs 100 Crore Seized In Bihar Ahead Of Polls
content: The Election Commission on Monday said enforcement agencies have seized illegal cash, drugs, liquor and other freebies worth more than Rs 100 crore from poll-bound Bihar and other states where assembly by-elections are scheduled.

title: Leadership change? 'Smriti Mandhana should take over from Harmanpreet Kaur'
content: Following India's historic ODI World Cup win, former captain Shantha Rangaswamy urged Harmanpreet Kaur to step down, believing it would benefit her batting and fielding. Rangaswamy suggested Smriti Mandhana as the ideal successor across formats, emphasizing the need for future planning. She also highlighted bowling as a concern despite the victory.

title: Nepal: 7 killed in avalanche on Yalung Ri mountain; 5 foreign climbers among dead
content: Tragedy struck Mount Yalung Ri in Nepal as an avalanche claimed the lives of seven individuals, including five foreign climbers and two local guides. Five others sustained injuries in the incident at the mountain's base camp. Rescue efforts are underway to reach the remote location, hampered by challenging terrain and weather.

title: Will George Pickens play against Arizona Cardinals tonight?
content: Dallas Cowboys' star receiver George Pickens is cleared to play in Monday Night Football against the Arizona Cardinals. The 24-year-old has been a vital offensive weapon, boasting impressive yardage and touchdown stats. His availability is crucial for Dallas' explosive passing attack as they aim to extend their winning streak at AT&T Stadium.

title: 'Nitish in BJP's lap': Cong takes jab at Bihar CM; Kharge makes big claim
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge attacked Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and the BJP, alleging the BJP will not reappoint Kumar as CM if NDA wins. Kharge accused Nitish of betraying socialist ideals by aligning with the BJP, which he claimed disregards Dalits, OBCs, and women. He also criticized PM Modi's governance and election campaigning.

title: Iconic! Harmanpreet recreates Dhoni’s pose; clicked with trophy at Gateway of India
content: India Women celebrated their historic first ICC Women's World Cup win in Mumbai, with captain Harmanpreet Kaur posing with the trophy. Deepti Sharma's stellar all-round performance earned her Player of the Tournament. The team aims to make winning a habit, marking a new era for Indian women's cricket. Fans reminisced about Dhoni and Team India's World Cup win in 2011.

title: SIR showdown in Tamil Nadu: CM Stalin cries EC 'conspiracy'; DMK moves SC
content: Tamil Nadu's ruling DMK has filed a Supreme Court petition challenging the Election Commission of India's Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls. This revision, set to begin November 4, covers 12 states, including Tamil Nadu, ahead of upcoming assembly polls. The ECI's SIR aims to ensure accurate voter lists through door-to-door verification.

title: Will Kyler Murray play against the Dallas Cowboys tonight?
content: Arizona Cardinals face the Dallas Cowboys tonight. Quarterback Kyler Murray is questionable with a foot sprain. Jacoby Brissett will start the game. Murray is recovering and may have a role, but his return is not confirmed. The Cardinals have lost five consecutive matches, causing fan concern. The game begins at 8:15 PM ET.

title: Jalen’s girlfriend Draya responds to Travis’s ex Kayla after NBA star’s Halloween show
content: Kayla Nicole's Halloween portrayal of Toni Braxton's "He Wasn't Man Enough" video sparked social media buzz, with fans interpreting it as a message to ex Travis Kelce.  The performance garnered praise from celebrities like Draya Michele, Angel Reese, and Claire Kittle, while fueling speculation about Nicole's past relationship with Kelce.

title: Massive recall of atorvastatin: What you need to know if you take cholesterol drugs
content: Both generic atorvastatin and brand-name Lipitor contain the same active ingredient — atorvastatin calcium — and are considered bioequivalent by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA). The drug is the top-selling medication in the US, with over 115 million prescriptions written for more than 29 million Americans.

title: Best moments, highlights from Dodgers' World Series parade
content: the los Angeles Dodgers defended their crown with a 5-4 win in 11-innings . it marked the first time in 25 years a franchise has won back-to-back titles . the 2020 victory brought no parade until four years later because of COVID .

title: Free agent pickups: Key adds ahead of Week 10
content: the ninth Sunday of the season featured a wild, defenseless slugfest in Buffalo . preseason top tight end Brock Bowers scored three touchdowns and a league-high 43.3 PPR points . cam Little blasted the longest field goal in NFL history .

title: NFL Week 9's top performance? Vote for the 'Himmy' Award winner
content: a 58-yard touchdown with 17 seconds left gave the Chicago Bears a 47-42 win in a wild finish . the Jacksonville Jaguars edged the Las Vegas Raiders by one point in overtime . this week's matchups were action-packed with standout perforation .

title: NFL trade grades: Are the Eagles all-in? Did the Dolphins get enough for Jaelan Phillips?
content: we often hear the old adage that it will take years to know how well each team did . when grading trades, I evaluate them for each team based on on-field impact, cap implications, draft compensation and effects . a low-impact decision can still receive a strong or poor grade .

title: Tracking every NFL trade deadline move: Jaelan Phillips to the Eagles
content: the 2025 trade deadline is Tuesday at 4 p.m. ET . we have you covered on every deal until the final second . the seahawks are an intriguing team to watch ahead of the trade deadline . here are all the deals leading up to the deadline, and keep checking back .

title: CFP top 12: One last projection before the first committee ranking
content: defending national champion Ohio State should start the first college football playoff rankings on Tuesday . there could be some debate over the top spot when the 12 members of this year's group vote on teams for their first official top 25 ranking of the season . the bigger discussion will likely revolve around one-loss Alabama and undefeated Texas A&M for the no. 3 and no. 4 spots .

title: Jayden Daniels' elbow injury: Answering the most pressing questions
content: the Washington Commanders' ugly season got a whole lot worse . Jayden Daniels was lying on the ground, in pain, after suffering a dislocated elbow . the commanders have been devastated by injuries and player absences since training camp opened .

title: Premier League 'Big Six' grades: Arsenal an A; Liverpool a D
content: the 2025-26 premier league season has reached a key stage . the so-called traditional "Big Six" have experienced wildly contrasting fortunes on their way to the 10-game mark . every top-flight team have now played 10 league games . four managers have already been fired .

title: Greatest World Series ever? No question for Dodgers-Blue Jays
content: apologies to 1991, the Los Angeles Dodgers and Toronto Blue Jays just finished the greatest World Series . it was the greatest world series because of its compelling storylines, some of which were impossible to believe . the first pinch-hit grand slam in World Series history was the first game to begiard .

title: Where Auburn ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: the 2025-26 coaching cycle wasn't expected to be calm, like its predecessor . but few forecast such a robust line of storms rolling through the sport in the first half of the season . all four power conferences have had a firing .

title: Resetting the CFP tiers after Week 10 and projecting the first bracket
content: two top-10 teams fell on the road to unranked opponents . a third fell to a lower-ranked team . two-thirds of the 2025 college football season done, we now shift into Playoff Hyperdrive .

title: The comprehensive guide to the women's hoops season, including preseason picks
content: the road to Phoenix and the women's final four starts Monday, when the 2025-26 season opens . some new names will be vying for national player of the year . the Huskies have moved on to the WNBA, and 'juJu Watkins' will sit out this season .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: 'It felt like a toxic environment': Stories from four QBs and their 15 schools
content: despite the haters, we've reached a peak moment for journeyman quarterbacks across college football . nearly 40 quarterbacks from the 2020 class came back this year for one more season at the FBS level . they're 23- and 24-year-old grizzled veterans who feel even older inside their locker rooms .

title: 🏈 CFB Power Ranking: Oregon moves into top 5
content: arch Manning waited until the last possible second before firing the ball to a leaping Emmett Mosley V in the end zone . the longhorns held on for a 34-31 win . he has 674 passing yards and six touchdowns in his past two starts .

title: As Cowboys fight for playoffs, Micah Parsons trade looms large
content: "Get Up" coach says he's been busy with his natural gas business . "you can't come off a game like [giving up 44 points to the Broncos] and not expect there to be changes," he says . but he doesn't talk about changes associated with trade deadline .

title: ‘Darbar Move’ to boost economy, bridge Jammu-Kashmir gap: CM Omar
content: tradition of shifting government offices from Srinagar to jammu in winter and vice-versa in summer was started by dogra rulers nearly 150 years ago . in June 2021, Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha halted the practice, citing the administration’s complete transition to e-office . tradition was revived by the Abdullah govt on Oct 16 .

title: 12 OD deaths in India every week: NCRB
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. Read More

title: Will scrap Adani power deal if graft is proved: Bangladesh
content: interim report claims "massive governance failure" and corruption . contracts affirm no corruption has taken place, but cancellation remains possible if evidence proves otherwise . the 25-year deal between Adani Power and Bangladesh is expected to expire in january .

title: Public prosecutor gets prosecuted by accused
content: the petitioner was prosecuting the accused - former police commissioner param Bir Singh and businessman Sanjay Punamiya - on complaints filed by another businessman . the senior advocate told a bench of cJI BR Gavai and justice K Vinod Chandran that the petition was being prosecuted by a special prosecutor .

title: Zubeen's death a murder case from day 1, says Assam CM
content: Prabin Kalita is a journalist at The Times of India and is currently the Chief of Bureau (northeast). He has been reporting in mainstream Indian national media since 2001. He has been a field journalist reporting gamut of issues from India’s northeastern region and major developments in neighbouring countries like Myanmar, China, Bhutan and Bangladesh concerning India and northeastern region. He has been covering insurgency—internal and cross-border, politics, natural calamities, environment etc. He is a post-graduate in Geological Sciences from Gauhati University. Read More
